quotes.quote: New Zealand looks like the future to me.
New Zealand is not a small country but a large village.
New Zealand is a country of thirty thousand million sheep, three million of whom think they are human.
New Zealand was one of the most beautiful countries to drive through for the scenery and the vast scale of the place.
Everywhere you turn in New Zealand, there's something exciting to do. It's the gem of the world. It's so far away from the madness, and so you get that element. It was just stunning.

There's a real purity in New Zealand that doesn't exist in the states. It's actually not an easy thing to find in our world anymore. It's a unique place because it is so far away from the rest of the world. There is a sense of isolation and also being protected.
The New Zealand sense of humor is tough and realistic. Jokes are not surreal; they are about life and death and tough decisions.
In New Zealand I think we often take ourselves too seriously, and being able to laugh at yourself is necessary in life without being too precious.
One of the best things about growing up in New Zealand is that if you are prepared to work hard and have faith in yourself, truly anything is possible.

New Zealand needs to balance its environmental responsibilities with its economic opportunities, because the risk is that if you don't do that - and you want to lead the world - then you might end up getting unintended consequences.
New Zealand is a place where you can get well.
New Zealand has incredible global recognition for grass-fed livestock.
New Zealand was colonised initially by those Australians who had the initiative to escape.
New Zealand as a whole needs to save more, spend less and reduce our reliance on foreign debt.
Living in New Zealand, it's like a different world - it is a different world. It's very, very cool.
New Zealand is such a down-to-earth place.
An interesting thing about New Zealand, you know, literature is that it really didn't begin in any real sense until the 20th century.
New Zealand - it's very tight-knit, and everyone knows each other.
People in New Zealand go out of their way to not be impressed by things.
I have heard that in the New Zealand native tradition, the soul, when it dies, becomes a star.
